## Key Concepts in Machine Learning ğŸ”‘

To get started with Machine Learning, familiarize yourself with these essential concepts:

### Data ğŸ“Š

Data is the foundation of ML. It can be structured (e.g., tables) or unstructured (e.g., text, images). The quality and quantity of your data will significantly impact your model's performance.

### Algorithms ğŸ§®

Algorithms are the building blocks of ML models. They help find patterns in data and make predictions based on those patterns. Examples include linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.

### Training and Testing ğŸ‹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸

Training is the process of using a dataset to teach an ML model. The model learns by adjusting its parameters based on feedback from the data. Testing helps evaluate the model's performance on unseen data, ensuring it can generalize well to new situations.

### Evaluation Metrics ğŸ“ˆ

Evaluation metrics are used to assess a model's accuracy and performance. Common metrics include Mean Squared Error (MSE), Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE), Accuracy, Precision, Recall, and F1 Score.
